business.headline: Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%

Can gold retain its glitter as Dalal Street gets back its glow?Just a week ago, gold was trading at record levels due to global uncertainty. Concerns over trade tensions, US tariffs, and geopolitical issues had pushed investors towards gold, a common choice during uncertain times.

New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

RBI's raises ATM charges to Rs 23 from May 1: Know the details herePeople living in metro cities would get three free transactions per month, while those living in non-metro areas would get five free transactions per month.

Rupee jumps to highest level in 2025. Check factors behind strong rallyThe Indian rupee reached its highest level of 2025, driven by foreign inflows and exporter dollar sales. Optimism over US-India trade talks and a weakening US dollar further supported the currency's rally.

'If we look closely...': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu on finding rural talentZoho's CEO, Sridhar Vembu, believes that India's path to development must include creating jobs and opportunities in smaller towns and villages.

5 Adani stocks get new targets after Q4 results: What should investors do?With Gautam Adani-led Adani Enterprises Ltd set to announce its earnings report soon, stock brokerages have already reviewed the performance of five listed companies from the group and shared fresh price targets and advice for investors.

Varun Beverages Q4 net profit at Rs 726 crore; firm announces interim dividendThe company posted a net profit of Rs 726 crore, up 35% year-on-year, driven by higher volumes and peak-season demand. Revenue for the quarter came in at Rs 5,680 crore, a 29% jump YoY, slightly ahead of most analyst estimates.

Vivad Se Vishwas 2.0 deadline ends today: Last call to settle income tax disputesVivad Se Vishwas 2.0 is a dispute resolution scheme run by the Income Tax Department. It gives taxpayers a chance to settle ongoing tax-related cases by avoiding the prolonged litigation process and simply paying the disputed tax amount.

Akshaya Tritiya 2025: Is falling gold price an opportunity to buy more?Akshaya Tritiya is considered a good day to buy gold. But with gold prices now close to all-time highs, near Rs 96,000 per 10 grams, many buyers are thinking twice before making big purchases this year.
Ather Energy IPO ends today: Should you subscribe or avoid?Ather Energy is struggling to generate investor interest, with sluggish IPO subscription levels and a muted grey market premium.

entertainment.headline: Vvan: Tamannaah Bhatia joins Sidharth Malhotra's upcoming folk thrillerTamannaah Bhatia is set to star alongside Sidharth Malhotra in the folk thriller 'Vvan-Force of the Forest.' A teaser showcasing her mysterious new avatar was released, coinciding with Chhath 2024 festivities.

Ajith Kumar hospitalised after minor leg injury in ChennaiActor Ajith Kumar has been hospitalised in Chennai after his return from New Delhi. The actor suffered a minor injury at the Chennai airport on Tuesday night.

Now You See Me 3 trailer: Jesse Eisenberg returns with his Horsemen for another heistThe 'Now You See Me 3' trailer has been released, reuniting the original cast with some new additions. Fans are in for a thrilling ride as the Four Horsemen take on a new heist.

It's a high-risk profession: Emraan Hashmi on emotional toll of playing BSF jawanIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Emraan Hashmi shared his experience of preparing for the role of a BSF officer in 'Ground Zero'. The actor talked about the physical and emotional challenges he faced during the filming

Costao movie review: Nawazuddin Siddiqui holds half-baked film about unsung heroReleased-Wed Apr 30, 2025In 'Costao', Nawazuddin Siddiqui plays an honest customs officer who is caught in the web of power and politics and is robbed of eight years of life after being accused of murder. While the actor performs fabulously, the story doesn't hold on its own despite being inspired by a heroic real-life incident.

Mouni Roy on botched surgery claims: People are writing rubbish, vicious thingsActor Mouni Roy recently responded to trolls who accused her of having cosmetic surgery, saying she feels sorry for them.

Content creator Misha Agrawal died by suicide, reveals sisterContent creator Misha Agrawal died by suicide just before her 25th birthday, her sister revealed. She shared that Misha had been under immense pressure due to decline in her social media followers.

Apoorva Mukhija says parents 'lost respect in a second': I put them through thatApoorva Mukhija became emotional in a promo for her interview with We Are Yuvaa, discussing the backlash from the India's Got Latent controversy.

Actor Shine Tom Chacko admitted to de-addiction centre amid drug abuse claimsMalayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko has been admitted to a rehab centre following drug abuse allegations by co-star Vincy Aloshious. He was earlier arrested and released on bail.
Housefull 5 teaser: Akshay Kumar's laugh riot gets a killer twist this timeAkshay Kumar's family entertainer, 'Housefull 5' teaser is finally out. The film will release in theatres on June 6.

Deepika Padukone-SRK to reunite for 5th time in King, shooting details out: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone seem to be paired together for the fifth time. The two will reportedly be seen alongside Suhana Khan in her debut film 'King'.

Javed Akhtar on Pakistani artistes in India: At this moment, I would say noVeteran screenwriter and lyricist Javed Akhtar shared his views on whether Pakistani artistes should be allowed to perform in India. He stated that it's a 'one-way traffic'.

Neha Kakkar refused to perform for just '700 people' in Melbourne: Event plannerSinger Neha Kakkar allegedly refused to perform at the Melbourne concert. One of the event organisers claimed that she wasn't satisfied with the turnout of 700 people and wanted to wait till the stadium filled up.

Kesari 2 box office Day 12: Akshay's film Rs 70 crore strong; Rs 100 crore possible?'Kesari Chapter 2' is doing well during the weekdays, and while it is already Rs 70 crore strong, it will be interesting to see if it manages to surpass the benchmark of Rs 100 crore by the end of this weekend or next week.

Thunderbolts review: Marvel's fun filler till the next Avenger dropsReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Florence Pugh simply stole the show with her performance in 'Thunderbolts*'.  The film offers a mix of entertainment and depth, making it a worthwhile addition to the franchise. Read our review.

Ajith credits wife Shalini for his success: There were times I took wrong decisionsActor Ajith Kumar, in an exclusive interview with India Today, credited his wife Shalini for his success. He stated that she stood by him even when he took wrong decisions.

TikTok's Delaney Rowe sparks romance buzz with actor B.J. NovakB.J. Novak and TikTok star Delaney Rowe are rumoured to be dating after multiple public sightings, though reps haven't confirmed. Fans on social media continue speculating about their relationship status.

First Look: Dwayne Johnson unrecognizable as Mark Kerr in The Smashing MachineDwayne Johnson transforms to play MMA legend Mark Kerr in The Smashing Machine, a gritty A24 sports drama exploring fame, addiction, and resilience. The film hits theaters October 3, 2025.

Ken Carson announces 2025 Arena tour after 'More Chaos' tops Billboard 200Following his chart-topping album More Chaos, Ken Carson announces a 30-city North American arena tour starting July 2025, marking a milestone moment in his rapidly rising hip-hop career.

general news.headline: Exclusive video of India's most wanted Hafiz Saeed's top-security Lahore homeIndia Today has accessed satellite pictures and videos that show how India's most wanted terrorist is living a comfortable life in Lahore under tight security by the Pakistani government.

Security advisory board revamped after Pahalgam attack, ex-RAW chief to head itThe move to revamp the National Security Advisory Board comes in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terrorist attack and amid tensions with Pakistan.

Pakistan turns panicistanIndia's display of resolve after the Pahalgam terror attacks in which 26 people were killed has spread panic among Pakistan's military and civilian authorities. The panic mode is on full display as Islamabad scurries officials to several world capitals, moves terrorists nourished by it into bunkers, pleads for a neutral probe and rushes forces to the border with India.

PM's 'super cabinet' meets just after top security body huddle over J&K attack  Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi chaired key Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) and Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA) meetings today amid tensions with Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

How Hafiz Saeed's hideout is different from that of bin Laden, Masood AzharSatellite images and footage exclusively accessed by India Today show the expansive compound where Lashkar chief Hafiz Saeed resides is situated in a posh locality in Pakistan's second-largest city.

PM Modi to skip Victory Day celebrations in Russia on May 9: ReportPrime Minister Narendra Modi will skip Russia's Victory Day celebrations on May 9, reportedly due to the situation following the terror attack in Pahalgam.

Mamata Banerjee inaugurates Puri-like Jagannath Temple in Bengal's DighaWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee the grand Jagannath Dham temple in Digha, a Rs 250-crore replica of Puri's Jagannath Temple, marking a culturally rich consecration ceremony.

ChatGPT isn't your creative assistant, it aids cheap mimicry of deep thinkingChatGPT is unlike the calculator, which did the heavy lifting, providing time for intellectual labour. AI tools are bypassing the human experience of creativity that involves grappling with form, structure, idea, inspiration and meaning. The end product is mimicry, and not authentic creativity.

Costao movie review: Nawazuddin Siddiqui holds half-baked film about unsung heroReleased-Wed Apr 30, 2025In 'Costao', Nawazuddin Siddiqui plays an honest customs officer who is caught in the web of power and politics and is robbed of eight years of life after being accused of murder. While the actor performs fabulously, the story doesn't hold on its own despite being inspired by a heroic real-life incident.

Hindu ho kya? Tourist recalls chilling encounter day before Pahalgam carnageTwenty-six people, mostly tourists, were killed and several were injured when terrorists opened fire at a meadow near the popular tourist town of Pahalgam in south Kashmir's Anantnag district on April 22.

Tamil Nadu techie on death row for minor's rape-murder acquitted of killing motherA Tamil Nadu techie sentenced to death for a child's rape and murder in 2017, has been acquitted in the murder of his mother by a Chengalpattu court citing lack of evidence.

Hindu monk Chinmoy Das, arrested for sedition in Bangladesh, gets bailChinmoy Das's arrest, which sparked outrage in India, came amid a crackdown on members of the Hindu community after the fall of the Sheikh Hasina-led regime.

Shaadi without a couple? Welcome to Delhi's fake wedding party sceneDelhi's party scene has a new trend: fake weddings. Guests dress in ethnic wear, dance to dhol beats, and celebrate. No couple or vows needed, just the vibe.

Class 10 ICSE, Class 12 ISC results declared. Direct link to download scorecardsCISCE ISC Class 12th, ICSE Class 10th Result 2025 Direct Link at cisce.org, results.cisce.org Live Updates: The websites to check and access the CISCE 2025 Class 10 and Class 12 results are cisce.org and DigiLocker. The CISCE Class 10 and Class 12 result rechecking window will be activated after the declaration of results today.

When Kashmir turned crimson with blood of PanditsIn part 3 of our series on the history of terror in Kashmir, we revisit the winter of 1989, when the blood of Kashmiris flowed through the Valley, leading to the biggest exodus in Independent India.

Here is a list of some of the youngest talents in the world who found recognition at a very young age.

Now You See Me 3 trailer: Jesse Eisenberg returns with his Horsemen for another heistThe 'Now You See Me 3' trailer has been released, reuniting the original cast with some new additions. Fans are in for a thrilling ride as the Four Horsemen take on a new heist.

You can help identify 5,00,000 galaxies captured by Webb TelescopeThe classification could help scientists answer questions about how the shapes of galaxies have changed over time, what caused these changes, and why.
Deven Bharti, who led 26/11 attacks probe, is new Mumbai police commissionerA 1994 batch IPS officer from Bihar, Deven Bharti has been serving as the Mumbai Police special commissioner since 2023.

How Pak got terror outfit's name dropped from UN statement on Pahalgam attackPakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar said as a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, Islamabad pushed to water down the language in the US-proposed statement, which originally named and shamed The Resistance Front.

Watch: Elderly woman tries to enter cockpit, gets knocked to ground by crewChaos broke out on an American Airlines flight when a woman tried to storm the cockpit over a delay. She was tackled by crew and was later removed by police. The incident delayed the flight from São Paulo to New York by over 2 hours.

Digital access a fundamental right, says Supreme Court in landmark verdictThe Supreme Court issued a slew of directions to ease banking and e-governance services for acid attack survivors with visual challenges.

Think Bihar breeds IAS toppers? This state outsmarts itUP's larger population base, broader access to educational resources, and longer history of administrative participation have given it a consistent edge.

Taking back POK only solution: India-born British MP on Pahalgam horrorIndian-origin British politician, Lord Meghnad Desai, has urged the Indian government to take over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) to resolve the longstanding Kashmir issue permanently. Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 innocent civilians, Desai emphasised that reclaiming the POK is the only way to solve the problem.

sports.headline: Telangana High Court stays removal of Azharuddin's name from Uppal StadiumThe Telangana High Court has put a stay on the decision to remove Mohammed Azharuddin's name from the north stand at the Uppal stadium. HCA Ombudsman Justice Eswaraiah ordered the removal of Azharuddin's name from the stand earlier in the month.

Rare ball-hitting talents: Manjrekar names his top young battersThe new generation of power-hitters in the IPL has impressed former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar. In his column, Manjrekar has named his top young batters this season.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi maiden IPL hundred: F1 driver Oscar Piastri praises RR batterFormula One driver Oscar Piastri heaped praise on Vaibhav Suryavanshi after his record-breaking hundred against GT. Suryavanshi shattered many records and his efforts pleased Piastri.

Virat Kohli's brother takes a dig at Sanjay Manjrekar after IPL strike-rate talkVirat Kohli's brother has taken a jibe at Sanjay Manjrekar after his talk about strike-rates in IPL 2025. Manjrekar has been praising the young batters for their fearless approach.

PSG coach praises 'Titan' Donnarumma after team closes in on UCL finalParis Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique praised the team's goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma after the match. Donnaruma made crucial stops as PSG beat Arsenal 1-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final.

Arsenal will need to do something special in Paris to reach UCL final: ArtetaMikel Arteta feels that his Arsenal side will need to do something special in Paris to make it to the final of the Champions League after their home loss to PSG.

Delhi Capitals suffering due to inconsistent top-order: Shaun PollockDelhi Capitals have dropped form in IPL 2025 due to their inconsistent batting order, said Shaun Pollock after the team's match against Kolkata Knight Riders. DC have lost 3 of their last 4 games.

Harshit needs to step up for KKR, he's not a newcomer anymore: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra feels that Harshit Rana needs to step up for KKR in the ongoing season of IPL 2025. The former cricketer said that Harshit isn't a newcomer anymore and needs to repay the faith Kolkata has put in him.

Rohit Sharma birthday: Yuvraj Singh, RCB and CSK lead the way with wishesThe cricketing world and fans wished Rohit Sharma on his 38th birthday on Wednesday, April 30. Rohit continues to show his class during the IPL 2025 season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
